RoadActivity.Description: The ramps from I-75 northbound to First Street and Third Street will be closed beginning Monday, October 15th at 9 am. These will be 24 hour a day ramp closures. A newly constructed ramp is scheduled to open to motorists in the downtown area in December of 2016. These ramp closures are due to a contractor reconfiguring I-75 in that location. This is part of the final phase of the I-75 modernization project.

U.S. 35 East will be reduced to one lane (eastbound direction) for a rock fall/slide repair project just east of C.R. 71 (Lloyds Bridge Road). Crews will be reconstructing the rock slopes and excavating along the eastbound lanes, where traffic will be reduced to one, 12-foot lane. Westbound traffic should not be affected during the initial phase of construction.

U.S. 50/Sixth Street Expressway work. Construction will require U.S. 50 to be restricted to one lane between Mehring Way and Evans Street, beginning at midnight September 12 and continuing to 9 a.m. September 13. One-way of two-way traffic will be maintained for the duration by a flagging operation. The lane restriction will be in place to accommodate a deck pour for a bridge over the Mill Creek. With the demolition of the old Waldvogel Viaduct, four new ramps are in place east and westbound Elberon, and east and westbound Warsaw to provide access to US 50. The first ramp, carrying west and eastbound Elberon traffic, was completed and opened to the public last year. The remaining three ramps, which are close to completion, should open to the public by early to mid-November. The safety railing remains to be installed on these three ramps, once fabrication is complete. In addition, access from State Avenue to U.S. 50 will open in November as well.

All lanes of I-90 eastbound are shifted towards the outside shoulder and the concret
e barrier is in place which will separate the eastbound traffic from the one oncoming lane of I-90 westbound traffic. The second lane of I-90 westbound will remain on the westbound side of the highway. I-90 east and westbound traffic between Paine Road and Painesville-Warren Road (SR 86) is no longer in the contraflow traffic configuration. Lanes will be shifted back into their normal configuration this spring. The entire project performs major pavement reconstruction on I-90 between Morley and Paine Roads. Motorists can expect the contra-flow traffic configuration and lane closures that will not impact peak travel times. Tentative completion date: fall 2014.

I-75 Mainline (Updated as of 9/25/14) -Lane closures on Interstate 75 are occurring in the northbound direction for pavement work during nighttime hours between Reservoir Road and Fourth Street. -Lane closures will occur this weekend in the southbound direction between Reservoir Road and Fourth Street beginning at 7 p.m. Friday until approximately noon on Monday, also for pavement work. -Both northbound and southbound Interstate 75 is now traveling in a new traffic pattern from just south of Fourth Street to the Auglaize County line. Traffic is operating in the contraflow pattern as follows: --On the northbound side of the interstate, two lanes of northbound traffic and one lane of southbound traffic is maintained. Opposing traffic is separated with a concrete barrier wall. --On the southbound side of the interstate, only one southbound lane is maintained. --The exception is an area north and south of McClain Road where all lanes of Interstate 75 are traveling on the northbound side and are then transitioned back to the established pattern. --This maintenance of traffic method will allow two lanes of traffic in each direction to be maintained, remove traffic from the existing pavement which is to be reconstructed, and create a safe work zone for the contractor. --Traffic will remain in this pattern for the remainder of the project, until 2016.
RoadActivity.DetourDescription:
-Motorists traveling southbound on Interstate 75 wishing to access Breese Road are directed to remain in the far-right southbound lane. -Motorists traveling southbound on Interstate 75 wishing to access Ohio 65 are also directed to remain in the far-right lane. The southbound exit ramp to Ohio 65
is currently closed and traffic is currently being detoured to Breese Road to Interstate 75 northbound back to Ohio 65. -Installation of cable rail in the median of the interstate is taking place between Fourth Street and Stewart Road. -Occasional lane restrictions are occurring throughout the entire work zone from the Auglaize County line to north of Ohio 81 during both daytime and nighttime hours. -Northbound and southbound Interstate 75 is now traveling on new concrete pavement from just south of Fourth Street to Stewart Road. -Motorists are advised to observe posted speeds through the work zone for their safety and the safety of workers. Speeds are being enforced by local law enforcement by ground and air patrol throughout the zone. -Motorists are asked to be aware of trucks entering and exiting the interstate throughout the work zone at various locations. Heed message boards and signs which indicate lane use, obey the posted speed and use caution when passing vehicles in the zone. -Traffic cameras may be accessed at www.odotlima75.com, or at www.Ohgo.com. -Please drive slowly through the construction zone.

RoadActivity.Description: Overnight through October, I-77 north and southbound motorists should expect lane closures at Valley Parkway as work takes place to rebuild the Valley Parkway bridge.

Beginning at 7 a.m., I-71 south will be reduced to two lanes between SR 61 and US 36/SR 37 so crews can begin work on the northbound lanes of I-71. Before work to build a third northbound lane can begin, ODOT must shift both directions of traffic over to the southbound lanes. Two lanes will be maintained in each direction on I-71 for the duration of the project. The first of three projects to widen 25 miles of I-71 in Delaware and Morrow Counties was completed last year between SR 95 and the Richland County Line. The other two projects are expected to be complete by Fall of this year.

Beginning Friday, April 18, at 12 p.m. noon, motorists traveling on I-77 southbound from Fohl Rd. to the Tuscarawas County line should be aware of a bi-directional traffic pattern. Although two lanes of traffic will be maintained in each direction on I-77, southbound traffic will be split with one lane of southbound traffic is crossed over onto I-77 northbound, while the second lane remains on I-77 southbound. This work is part of a $14.3 million project to resurface I-77 from SR 800 to the Tuscarawas County line. This project also includes bridge repairs and the replacement of two bridges on I-77 over Gracemont Ave. The entire project is scheduled to be completed by October

The entire project is scheduled to be completed by early October 2014.

NOTE: SR 60 was reopened from August 30-September 7, however it is necessary to close the road again on September 8 to complete the remaining work. The road will reopen late September, weather permitting.

Stream relocation along the eastern side of SR 177 from SR 73 to Butler/Preble county line in Milford Township. Work includes replacing and rehabilitating multiple culverts and driveway pipes. SR 177 will be widened for standard width; riprap and rock channel protection will be placed and guardrail
added. Once complete, the road will be resurfaced. **Culvert work requires closing State Route 177 in Milford Township for 60 days. Beginning Monday, Aug. 4, State Route 177 will be closed between Somerville Road and Oren Road to the north. Traffic will be detoured east on SR 73 to north on U.S. 127 to west on SR 725 in Preble county to south on SR 732, back to SR 177. A local detour will also be posted.** Arrow boards and/or signs will be in place to alert motorists of the upcoming road closure and detours. To help ensure the safety of the construction workers as well as the traveling public, motorists should remain alert, reduce their speed and watch for stopped traffic while passing through the work zone.

SR 2, between Murray Ridge Road and the I-90/I-80 split, has single lane closures each night to place temporary pavement in advance of a bridge replacement project. While the bridges will be replaced next year, the temporary pavement work is expected to be complete in mid-November 2014.
